item.text: Paul Rodwell assembled this animation from the various github repositories we've used throughout the Smallest Federated Wiki project.
<iframe width="420" height="236" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/hh4VpfnKAkg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe><i>35 Contributors Create Federated Wiki
<iframe width="420" height="236" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/hh4VpfnKAkg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe><i>Fourty Contributors Create Federated Wiki
<iframe width="420" height="236" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/hh4VpfnKAkg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe><i>Thirty Contributors Create Federated Wiki

In the summer of 2013 we set out to reorganize the project towards delivery of easily installed components. One repository became many. The most dramatic changes happen in the last few seconds of this movie.
<iframe width="420" height="236" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/hh4VpfnKAkg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe><i>Forty Contributors Create Federated Wiki

Software projects are displayed by Gource as an animated tree with the root directory of the project at its centre. Directories appear as branches with files as leaves. Developers can be seen working on the tree at the times they contributed to the project.

Software projects are displayed by Gource as an animated tree with the root directory of the project at its centre. Directories appear as branches with files as leaves. Developers can be seen working on the tree at the times they contributed to the project. [https://code.google.com/p/gource/ code]

Sometimes it may be interesting to show the history of multiple projects in the same Gource animation. For instance: development activity in sub modules used by a project, multiple projects worked on by the same developers / company, or maybe different forks of a project.

story.text: Paul Rodwell assembled this animation from the various github repositories we've used throughout the Smallest Federated Wiki project.

YOUTUBE hh4VpfnKAkg
Twenty-some Contributors Create Federated Wiki

In the summer of 2013 we set out to reorganize the project towards delivery of easily installed components. One repository became many. The most dramatic changes happen in the last few seconds of this movie.

Software projects are displayed by Gource as an animated tree with the root directory of the project at its centre. Directories appear as branches with files as leaves. Developers can be seen working on the tree at the times they contributed to the project. [https://code.google.com/p/gource/ code]

Sometimes it may be interesting to show the history of multiple projects in the same Gource animation. For instance: development activity in sub modules used by a project, multiple projects worked on by the same developers / company, or maybe different forks of a project. [https://code.google.com/p/gource/wiki/GourceMashups wiki]
